questions.question: 1. The water content of a soil sample cannot be determined by _____ method.

explanations.d: The pipette method is the standard sedimentation method used in laboratory for wet mechanical or sedimentation analysis.

questions.question: 2. In oven drying method, the soil sample is kept for about ______ hours in the oven.

explanations.d: For complete drying, sandy soil takes about 4 hours and fat clays take about 14 to 16 hours. To assure complete drying of sample, it is kept for about 24 hours.

questions.question: 3. A soil has bulk density of 22 kN / m^3 and a dry density of 20 kN / m^3. What is the water content of the soil?

explanations.a: It is a dirtect application of the formula.

questions.question: 4. The values of water content for natural granular soils vary from less than 0.1% for air dry sands to more than 40% for saturated sands.

explanations.a: Water content depends on relative density of soil.
explanations.b: Water content depends on relative density of soil.
